sect2.title: Introduction to ALSA Library
sect2.para: The ALSA Library package contains the ALSA library. This is used by programs (including ALSA Utilities) requiring access to the ALSA sound interface.

sect2.title: Installation of ALSA Library
sect2.para: In the Sound section of the kernel configuration, edit Advanced Linux Sound Architecture options to match your audio hardware and disable deprecated Open Sound System. Recompile and install your new kernel.
Install ALSA Library by running the following commands:
If you have JACK installed and you wish to build the JACK PCM plugin library, run the following commands:

userinput.command: cd src/pcm/ext && make jack && make install-jack && cd ../../..

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: --enable-static: This switch is used to enable building the static library because some programs link against it.

sect3.title: Configuration information
sect3.para: The default alsa.conf is adequate for most installations. For extra functionality and/or advanced control of your sound device, you may need to create additional configuration files. For information on the available configuration parameters, including setup of the JACK PCM plugin, visit .

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The ALSA Library package contains aserver, alsalisp, the libasound library and optionally, the JACK PCM plugin library.

sect3.title: libasound (alsa library)
sect3.para: libasound provides ALSA functions for application programs.
